result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier C Scaife was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier C Scaife

records.addlTxt: Civil judgment to be entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
DOC-notice of court ordered financial obligations status - balance due on court ordered financial obligations $450.14.  Defendant due to discharge 06-28-2018.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letters for sentencing on behalf of the def
Sentencing hearing on June 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions going to court, meeting with atty, and going to work.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 01-05-2016: GPS MAY BE REMOVED

Defendant Xavier C Scaife in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to charge, the State indicates there is a joint recommendation w/held sent - 2 yrs probation; no alc/cs-UA's, AODA, FT emp, 6 mos RCJ as condition of prob and the State has agreed not to issue any BJ charges arising out of this matter.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
defendant waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Ms. Paul asks to be heard on the conditions of GPS. Defense asks the Court to allow deft to search for work and to attend subsequent employment.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. GPS may be removed  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Xavier C Scaife in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for COP  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Xavier C Scaife in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks for COP. The State indicates that given the latest ZCI report, the State asks that it be set for STC. 

BTC: Deft to go to ZCI immediately after court  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier C Scaife in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions going to court, meeting with atty, and going to work.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Xavier C Scaife in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Xavier C Scaife in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
